634720-d-05-31-09-EJE.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT 1-WEST-10 HAD SHOVED 2 CARS TO A COUPLING IN MIDDLE-2.  THE CREW STRETCHED THE TRACK ANDFOUND THAT ALL CARS IN THE TRACK WERE NOT COUPLED.  CREW FOUND CRUMPLING DAMAGE TO THE BODY OF MLLX97861.  FURTHER INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT 1 WEST20 WAS SWITCHING TRACK M04 AT APPROXIMATELY 19:00 ON5/31/09 AT THE SOUTH END OF THE JOLIET YARD.  THE CREW HAD KICKED 3 LOADED HOPPER CARS INTO TRACK M02 WITH MLLX 97861 ON THE LEAD.  TRACK M02 ALREADY CONTAINED 11 MORE LOADED CARS.  THE IMPACT BETWEENTHE 3 KICKED CARS ON TOP OF THE OTHER 11 CAUSED THE NORTH END OF MLLX 97861 TO PUSH IN TOWARD THE CENTER OF THE CAR, CRUMBLING THE WALLS AT THE A-END OF THE CAR.  THE CREW WAS UNAWARE OF THE DAMAGE UNTIL FOUND THE NEXT DAY BY 1-WEST-10'S CREW.  THE COUPLERS DID NOT BYPASS AND THE CAR WAS NOT CORNERED.

TX0509115-d-05-29-09-BNSF.Narrative: L-TEX4031-29A TRAIN TRAVELING EAST ON SINGLE MAIN TRACK IN EMERGENCY.  INSPECTION FOUND (2) CARS DERAILED ON 95 FEET OPEN DECK WOOD TRESTLE OF APPROX. 16 FEET IN HEIGHT.  NCHX 99821 HAS TRAILING TRUCKSUSPENDED IN THE AIR OVER A COLLAPSED PORTION OF THE BRIDGE.  NAHX 94366 IS LAYING UPRIGHT, BUT LISTING IN EAST OF STINKY CREEK.  PER TR&D HAS DETERMINED THAT THE SUBMITTED BROKEN RAIL WAS NOT THE CAUSE - PLACED BACK IN M505 STATUS.  PER TR&D, THIS DERAILMENT BE CLOSED OUT PER CAUSE CODE T108, TRACK ALIGNMENT IRREGULAR (OTHER THAN BUCKLED/SUNKINK) BASED ON A LARGE SPIKE IN THE L/V FOUND THROUGH SIMULATION AND ATTRIBUTED TO A TRACK MISALIGNMENT.  IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT EVEN WITH THE ALIGNMENT PROJECTED TO HAVE INCREASED BY MAY 29, 2009, IT WOULD NOT HAVE EXCEEDED THAT ALLOWED FOR CLASS 2 TRACK.

09060-d-05-14-09-ARR.Narrative: WHILE OPERATING A LOCOMOTIVE CRANE, OPERATOR PICKED 35 FOOT BRIDGE SPAN TO REMOVE IT FROM A FLAT CAR, IN FRONT OF THE CRANE, AND PLACE IT TO A LOCATION ON THE GROUND,  9'2'' FROM THE CENTER OF THE FLAT CAR.  THE BRIDGE SPAN WAS ESTIMATED TO WEIGH 35K LBS AND ACTUALLY WEIGHED 43,600 LBS.  THE LIFT LIMITS FOR THE CRANE AT THE RADIUS OF THE LIFT 30,900 LBS, WITHOUT OUTRIGGERS DEPLOYED.  THE OUTRIGGERS WERE NOT USED IN THIS INCIDENT.  THE LIFT WAS MADE AND THE BOOM SWUNG TO THE LEFT AND THE MOMENTUMCARRIED THE BRIDGE SPAN TO A POINT WHERE THE CRANE TIPPED TO ITS SIDE.  NO INJURIES RESULTED FROM THIS INCIDENT.

2009050117-d-05-29-09-PUCC.Narrative: ON FRIDAY, MAY 29, 2009, THE PUC SWITCH CREW WAS PULLING A LOADED HIGH AND WIDE CAR FROM THE COLUMBUS ST. HIGH DOCK WHEN THE INCIDENT OCCURRED.  ONCE THE CREW HAD PULLED THE CAR INTO THE STRAIGHT TRACK THE CREW OF THE HIGH AND WIDE INSTRUCTED THEM TO STOP THE MOVEMENT SO AS TO MAKE ADJUSTMENTS TO THE RAILCAR.  AFTER ADJUSTMENTS WERE MADE THE SWITCH CREW WAS INSTRUCTED TO PROCEED WITH THE MOVE.  THE HIGH AND WIDE RAILCAR WAS MOVED APPROXIMATELY TWO RAIL CAR LENGTHS BEFORE THE GENERATOR LOADED ONTHE RAILCAR BEGAN TO TIP OVER RESULTING IN THE WHEELS OF THE TRAILING TRUCK ON RAILCAR KRL 204001 TODERAIL AND THE GENERATOR FALLEN TO THE PAVEMENT.

0509PR031-d-05-27-09-UP.Narrative: CWKNA-28 DOUBLING TRK 1 TO EAST PASS. TRK 1 HAD LEAD UNIT & EAST PASS HAD DPU UNIT.  PRIOR TO MAKINGMOVE CONDUCTOR CLOSED ANGLE COCKS ON BOTH CUTS TO REMOVE AIR HOSE CONNECTING BOTH CUTS WHICH WAS USED TO CONDUCT THE AIR TEST, BUT FAILED TO OPEN ANGLE COCK AFTER REMOVING AIR HOSE CAUSING THE AIR ONCUT OF CARS TO PASS TRK TO BE BOTTLED. RAIL = CWR

211259-d-05-04-09-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT GY31 BACKED POWER OFF RUNNING TRACK INTO FT21. CREW WAS WAITING FOR INBOUND TRAIN 280-03TO CREW THE LEAD. GY31 CONDUCTOR LINED SWITCH FOR THE LEAD AND CREW WAITED FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 HOURTHEN RECEIVED INSTRUCTIONS TO LEAVE THE POWER ON THE RUNNER AND WAIT FOR TAXI. ENGINEER PULLED FORWARD AND MADE CONTACT WITH 280-03 THAT HAD NOT CLEARED THE LEAD. GY31 LOCOMOTIVE CEFX 1035 STRUCK 47THCAR OF 280-03 (GNWR 410096).

211429-d-05-14-09-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 282-13 WAS YARDED ON TRACK F6. THE CONDUCTOR MADE A CUT ON F6 WHILE THE U-MAN GOT THE LINE-UPAND WAS TAXIED TO RUBY STREET TO LINE THE SPRING SWITCHES TO DOUBLE INTO THE A-YARD. THE ENGINEER PULLED THE TRAIN OUT 3 LEAD AND CROSSOVER 4 LEAD TO 5 LEAD AT THE BOTTLENECK. THE TWO LOCOMOTIVES ANDA TOTAL OF 55 CARS MADE IT OVER THESE CROSSOVERS BEFORE THE 56TH CAR, TR150335, DERAILED ON THE WESTSWITCH OF THE 3 LEAD CROSSOVER. A TOTAL OF 5 CARS DERAILED. THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS JUST EAST OF THE FROG OF THIS SWITCH WHERE WHEEL MARKS SHOWED THE SOUTH WHEELS FALLING INSIDE OF THE GAUGE FACEOF THE RAIL. THE NORTH RAIL HAD SHIFTED UP AND OVER THE SHOULDER OF THE PLATES AND HAD SHEARED OFFTHE HEADS OF SEVERAL SPIKES. SEVERAL NEW TIES HAD BEEN INSTALLED UNDER THIS SWITCH EARLIER IN THE DAY AND WORK WAS TO BE COMPLETED THE FOLLOWING DAY.

211659-d-05-31-09-SOO.Narrative: G42 AT BRC CLEARING TRIPLED TRACKS 30, 33, AND 36 TOGETHER TO BUILD THEIR 119 CAR OUTBOUND TRAIN.  THE HEAD END WAS BLOCKING 65TH STREET.  CONDUCTOR USED THE BRC CAB AND WENT TO THE REAR OF THE TRAINTO PROTECT APPROX 15 CAR LENGTH SHOVE TO CLEAR THE CROSSING AND INTERLOCKING.  HE LINED THE SWITCHESFOR THE SHOVE FROM TRACK 36 TO THE NORTH THOROUGHFARE, BUT APPARENTLY OVERLOOKED THE 32/37-29/31SWITCH WAS NOT LINED FOR HIS MOVEMENT.  HE GAVE ENGINEER 2 CAR COUNTS OF 10 EACH BEFORE THE CROSSING WAS CLEARED.  CONDUCTOR RETURNED TO THE HEAD END AND PREPARED FOR DEPARTURE.  AS THEY PULLED, A UDE OCCURRED, 6 CARS DERAILED AND TRACK DAMAGE RESULTED.  THE 32/37-29/31SWITCH WAS EXAMINED BY BRC & CP MANAGERS AND FOUND SWITCH WAS LINED AGAINST THE INTENDED MOVEMENT AND THE POINT WAS GAPPED.  THE SWITCH POINT WAS BENT AND DID NOT ALLOW THE SWITCH TO BE THROWN TO THE PROPER POSITION.  OTHER WHEEL MARKS ON THE RAIL INDICATED HOW THE POINT BECAME GAPPED. 6/2/09 BRC ADVISED $13,500 TRACK REPAIRS. 3 OFTHE EMPTY CARS DERAILED WITH RESIDUE ETHYLENE GLYCOL.

D22050909-d-05-09-09-FEC.Narrative: TRAIN WAS TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND APPROACHING MP 59.9 WHEN THEY NOTICED THE TRACK WAS BUCKLED.  WHEN THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE ENTERED THIS SECTION OF TRACK, IT DERAILED, TRAVELING TO THE WEST SIDE OF THE MAINLINE CAUSING ENGINES 104, 701 AND 25 CARS TO DERAIL.  THE 17TH CAR THAT DERAILED, TILX 110210, WAS ATANK CAR THAT WAS FILLED WITH HYDROCHLORIC ACID (UN 1789) THAT RELEASED 16,800 GALLONS OF PRODUCT.UPON INVESTIGATION, THERE WAS NO INDICATION OF RUNNING RAIL OR TRACK MOVEMENT THAT WOULD BE CONSISTENT WITH THE TRACK BUCKLING OR A SUN KINK NOR WAS THERE ANY INDICATION THAT THE TRACK HAD BEEN STRUCK BY A VEHICLE.  THE CONDUCTOR SUSTAINED A LOWER BACK STRAIN/SPRAIN AND CONTUSION TO LEFT THIGH.

0905181-d-05-18-09-MMA.Narrative:
AT APPROXIMATELY 0800 MONDAY MAY 18, 2009, NO. 210-18, NORTHERN MAINE JCT. SINGLE-MAN SWITCH ENGINEDERAILED 15TH THROUGH 18TH HEAD CARS WHILE PULLING NO. 203-17S INBOUND TRAIN DOWN THE SOUTH FREIGHTTRACK AT THE FARM IN HERMON YARD.  AT THE TIME OF THE DERAILMENT, THE HEAD-END HAD ENTERED TRACKNO. 6 LOOP (CLOCK-WISE).

NO INJURIES; NO HAZMAT RELEASE.

POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS AT THE RIGHT-HAND SWITCH POINT OF THE NO. 90 SWITCH; R2 WHEEL (LEADING WHEEL OF TRAILING TRUCK) OF PROX 16219, LOAD SULPHURIC ACID, CLIMBED THE SWITCH POINT AND TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY FOUR INCHES ON TOP OF THE RAIL BEFORE FALLING IN BETWEEN THE POINT AND STOCK RAIL.  R2 WHEEL ON PROX 16219 WAS FOUND TO HAVE A SHARP FLANGE. THIS NON-CONDEMNING  WHEEL WITH SHARP FLANGE IS BELIEVED TO HAVE CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.THE LOCOMOTIVE AND 14 CARS PRIOR TO PROX 16219 SAFELY NEGOTIATED THE POINT BEFORE THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED.


DERAILED CARS:

15TH HEAD           CRGX  30056 LOAD (ETHANOL); A (TRAILING TRUCK);UPRIGHT, IN-LINE WITH TRACK
16TH HEAD           PROX  16219 LOAD (SULPHURIC ACID) ALL WHEELS; UPRIGHT, REAR OF CAR AT APPROXIMATE 45-DEGREE ANGLE TO TRACK
17TH HEAD           GATX  7992 LOAD (SULPHURIC ACID) ALL WHEELS; UPRIGHT, FRONT OF CAR AT APPROXIMATE 35-DEGREE ANGLE TO TRACK (AND 80-DEGREEANGLE TO PRECEDING CAR)
18TH HEAD           GATX 95 LOAD (SULPHURIC ACID) B (LEADING TRUCK); UPRIGHT, IN-LINE WITH TRACK, TRAILING TRUCK WHEELS APPROXIMATELY FOUR FEET FROM RAIL

AT THE TIME OF T
